unnormalised: Gastroenterology, often shortened to "GI", is a branch of medicine focused on the digestive system. It encompasses a wide range of conditions, from common ailments like acid reflux to more serious diseases like colon cancer. Understanding the basics of GI health is crucial for overall well-being, especially given the dietary habits and lifestyle prevalent in India. Many consult Dr. Verma for GI issues.
normalised: Gastroenterology, often shortened to G-I, is a branch of medicine focused on the digestive system. It encompasses a wide range of conditions, from common ailments like acid reflux to more serious diseases like colon cancer. Understanding the basics of G-I health is crucial for overall well-being, especially given the dietary habits and lifestyle prevalent in India. Many consult Doctor Verma for G-I issues.

unnormalised: One of the most common GI problems in India is Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS), affecting approx. 10-15% of the population. Symptoms include abdominal pain, bloating, and altered bowel habits. While the exact cause is unknown, stress and certain foods can trigger IBS. Another prevalent condition is GERD, or gastroesophageal reflux disease, where stomach acid flows back into the esophagus. Treatment often involves lifestyle changes, OTC medications, and sometimes, surgical intervention. Diagnostic procedures include colonoscopies and endoscopies.
normalised: One of the most common G-I problems in India is Irritable Bowel Syndrome (I-B-S), affecting approximately ten to fifteen percent of the population. Symptoms include abdominal pain, bloating, and altered bowel habits. While the exact cause is unknown, stress and certain foods can trigger I-B-S. Another prevalent condition is G-E-R-D, or gastroesophageal reflux disease, where stomach acid flows back into the esophagus. Treatment often involves lifestyle changes, over the counter medications, and sometimes, surgical intervention. Diagnostic procedures include colonoscopies and endoscopies.

unnormalised: Helicobacter pylori (H. pylori) infection is also widespread, affecting a significant portion of the Indian population. This bacterium can cause gastritis, ulcers, and increase the risk of stomach cancer. A simple breath test or a stool test can diagnose H. pylori. Treatment usually involves a combination of antibiotics and acid-suppressing medications. The cost of treatment can vary widely, ranging from Rs. 2000 to Rs. 10000, depending on the diagnostic tests required and the medications prescribed. AIIMS Delhi sees many cases of H. Pylori each year.

unnormalised: Maintaining a healthy digestive system involves several key steps. Firstly, a balanced diet rich in fiber, fruits, and vegetables is essential. Limiting the intake of processed foods, oily foods, and spicy foods can also help prevent GI problems. Regular exercise, adequate hydration (2-3 liters of water per day), and stress management are also crucial. Prebiotics and probiotics found in foods such as curd (dahi) can aid in maintaining gut health.

unnormalised: In conclusion, taking care of your digestive health is paramount. Awareness of common GI conditions, understanding risk factors, and adopting healthy lifestyle habits can significantly improve your well-being. Consult a gastroenterologist like Dr. Patel if you experience persistent symptoms or have concerns about your digestive health. Remember, early detection and timely intervention are vital for managing GI conditions effectively.
